023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.MAINTAINED;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap.ConfigAnnotationProcessor.MSG_DuplicateProperty;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap.ConfigAnnotationProcessor.MSG_IllegalImplementation;

079/**
080 *  An instance of this class provides the configuration for the code
081 *  generation, and it collects the results from the different code generators.
082 *
083 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
084 *  @version $Id: CodeGenerationConfiguration.java 999 2022-01-27 23:23:26Z tquadrat $
085 *  @UMLGraph.link
086 *  @since 0.1.0
087 */
088@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyFields", "ClassWithTooManyMethods"} )
089@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeGenerationConfiguration.java 999 2022-01-27 23:23:26Z tquadrat $" )
090@API( status = MAINTAINED, since = "0.1.0" )
091public final class CodeGenerationConfiguration
092{
093        /*------------*\
094    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
095        \*------------*/
096    /**
097     *  The base bundle name for the resource bundle if i18n support is
098     *  required.
099     *
100     *  @note   This is <i>not</i> the value but the fully qualified field name
101     *      where to find that value!
102     */
103    private String m_BaseBundleName = null;
104
105    /**
106     *  The optional base class for the new configuration bean.
107     */
108    private final TypeName m_BaseClass;
109
110    /**
111     *  The build time; this is provided by the configuration as this allows
112     *  easier testing.
113     */
114    private final Instant m_BuildTime = Instant.now();
115
116    /**
117     * The class name for the configuration bean class, without the package.
118     */
119    private final Name m_ClassName;
120
121    /**
122     * The
123     * {@link JavaComposer}
124     * instance that is used for the code generation.
125     */
126    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
127    private final JavaComposer m_Composer;
128
129    /**
130     *  The processing environment.
131     */
132    private final APHelper m_Environment;
133
134    /**
135     *  The comment for the configuration file.
136     */
137    private String m_INIFileComment = null;
138
139    /**
140     *  The flag that indicates whether the configuration must exist prior to
141     *  the first open attempt.
142     */
143    private boolean m_INIFileMustExist;
144
145    /**
146     *  The path for the configuration file.
147     */
148    private Path m_INIFilePath = null;
149
150    /**
151     *  The {@code INI} file groups. The key is the name of the group, the
152     *  value is the respective comment for the group.
153     */
154    private final Map<String,String> m_INIGroups = new TreeMap<>();
155
156    /**
157     *  The method that is provided as a source for the initialisation of the
158     *  properties of the configuration bean.
159     */
160    private MethodSpec m_InitDataMethod = null;
161
162    /**
163     * The name of the resource that is used to initialise the properties of
164     * the configuration bean.
165     */
166    private String m_InitDataResource = null;
167
168    /**
169     *  The interfaces that are extended by the configuration bean
170     *  specification.
171     */
172    private final Collection<TypeName> m_InterfacesToImplement = new HashSet<>();
173
174    /**
175     *  The message prefix for the i18n support.
176     *
177     *  @note   This is <i>not</i> the value but the fully qualified field name
178     *      where to find that value!
179     */
180    private String m_MessagePrefix = null;
181
182    /**
183     * The name of the package for the configuration bean.
184     */
185    private final Name m_PackageName;
186
187    /**
188     *  The change listener class for the {@code Preferences}.
189     */
190    private TypeName m_PreferenceChangeListenerClass;
191
192    /**
193     *  <p>{@summary The properties for the configuration bean.} The name of
194     *  the property is the key.</p>
195     */
196    private final SortedMap<String, PropertySpecImpl> m_Properties = new TreeMap<>( caseInsensitiveComparator() );
197
198    /**
199     *  The configuration bean specification.
200     */
201    private final ClassName m_Specification;
202
203    /**
204     *  The name of the preferences root node.
205     */
206    private String m_PreferencesRoot = null;
207
208    /**
209     *  A map of
210     *  {@link StringConverter}
211     *  implementations that use instances of
212     *  {@link TypeName}
213     *  as keys.
214     */
215    private final LazyMap<TypeName,ClassName> m_StringConvertersForTypeNames;
216
217    /**
218     *  This flag indicates whether the access to the configuration bean
219     *  properties must be thread-safe.
220     */
221    private final boolean m_SynchronizeAccess;
222
223        /*--------------*\
224    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
225        \*--------------*/
226    /**
227     *  Creates an instance of {@code CodeGenerationConfiguration}.
228     *
229     *  @param  environment The access to the processing environment.
230     *  @param  composer    The
231     *      {@link JavaComposer}
232     *      instance that is used for the code generation.
233     *  @param  specification   The configuration specification, the interface
234     *      that defines the configuration bean.
235     *  @param  className   The name for the configuration bean class, without
236     *      the package name.
237     *  @param  packageName The name of the package for the configuration bean
238     *      class.
239     *  @param  baseClass   The optional base class for the new configuration
240     *      bean class.
241     *  @param  synchronizeAccess   {@code true} if the access to the
242     *      configuration bean properties should be thread safe, {@code false}
243     *      if a synchronisation/locking is not required.
244     */
245    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
246    public CodeGenerationConfiguration( final APHelper environment, final JavaComposer composer, final ClassName specification, final Name className, final Name packageName, final TypeName baseClass, final boolean synchronizeAccess )
247    {
248        m_Environment = requireNonNullArgument( environment, "environment" );
249        m_Composer = requireNonNullArgument( composer, "composer" );
250        m_ClassName = requireNotEmptyArgument( className, "className" );
251        m_PackageName = requireNonNullArgument( packageName, "packageName" );
252        m_Specification = requireNonNullArgument( specification, "specification" );
253        m_BaseClass = baseClass;
254        m_SynchronizeAccess = synchronizeAccess;
255
256        m_StringConvertersForTypeNames = LazyMap.use( true, this::initStringConvertersForTypeNames );
257    }   //  CodeGenerationConfiguration()
258
259        /*---------*\
260    ====** Methods **==========================================================
261        \*---------*/
262    /**
263     *  Adds an {@code INI} file group.
264     *
265     *  @param  name    The name for the group.
266     *  @param  comment The comment for the group.
267     */
268    public final void addINIGroup( final String name, final String comment )
269    {
270        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( name ) )
271        {
272            if( isEmptyOrBlank( comment ) )
273            {
274                m_INIGroups.remove( name );
275            }
276            else
277            {
278                m_INIGroups.put( name, comment );
279            }
280        }
281    }   //  addINIGroup()
282
283    /**
284     *  Adds an {@code INI} file group.
285     *
286     *  @param  group   The group definition.
287     */
288    public final void addINIGroup( final INIGroup group )
289    {
290        addINIGroup( requireNonNullArgument( group, "group" ).name(), group.comment() );
291    }   //  addINIGroup()
292
293    /**
294     *  Adds some interfaces that have to be implemented by the new
295     *  configuration beam.
296     *
297     *  @param  interfacesToImplement   The classes for the interfaces to
298     *      implement.
299     */
300    public final void addInterfacesToImplement( final Collection<? extends TypeName> interfacesToImplement )
301    {
302        m_InterfacesToImplement.addAll( requireNotEmptyArgument( interfacesToImplement, "interfacesToImplement" ) );
303    }   //  addInterfaceToImplement()
304
305    /**
306     *  <p>{@summary Adds a property to the new configuration bean.}</p>
307     *  <p>If a property with the same name as the new one already exists, a
308     *  {@link CodeGenerationError}
309     *  will be thrown.</p>
310     *
311     *  @param  property    The property
312     *  @throws CodeGenerationError There is a duplicate property.
313     */
314    public final void addProperty( final PropertySpec property ) throws CodeGenerationError
315    {
316        if( requireNonNullArgument( property, "property" ) instanceof PropertySpecImpl propertyImpl )
317        {
318            final var propertyName = propertyImpl.getPropertyName();
319            if( nonNull( m_Properties.put( propertyName, propertyImpl ) ) )
320            {
321                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_DuplicateProperty, propertyName ) );
322            }
323        }
324        else
325        {
326            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalImplementation, PropertySpec.class.getName(), property.getClass().getName() ) );
327        }
328    }   //  addProperty()
329
330    /**
331     *  <p>{@summary Creates a registry of the known
332     *  {@link StringConverter}
333     *  implementations.}</p>
334     *  <p>The
335     *  {@link TypeName}
336     *  of the subject class is the key for that map, the {@code TypeName} for
337     *  the {@code Class} implementing the {@code StringConverter} is the
338     *  value.</p>
339     *
340     *  @return An immutable map of
341     *      {@link StringConverter}
342     *      implementations.
343     *
344     *  @throws IOException Failed to read the resource files with the
345     *      {@code StringConverter} implementations.
346     */
347    @SuppressWarnings( "NestedTryStatement" )
348    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
349    public static final Map<TypeName,ClassName> createStringConverterRegistry() throws IOException
350    {
351        final Map<TypeName,ClassName> buffer = new HashMap<>();
352
353        /*
354         * For some reason, the original code for this method does not work:
355         *
356         * for( final var c : StringConverter.list() )
357         * {
358         *    final var container = StringConverter.forClass( c );
359         *    if( container.isPresent() )
360         *    {
361         *       final var stringConverterClass = TypeName.from( container.get().getClass() );
362         *       final var key = TypeName.from( c );
363         *       buffer.put( key, stringConverterClass );
364         *       ifDebug( "StringConverters: %1$s => %2$s"::formatted, key, stringConverterClass );
365         *    }
366         * }
367         *
368         * This code relies on the code in the foundation-util module, so I
369         * assumed the problem there and move the code to here:
370         *
371         * final var moduleLayer = StringConverter.class.getModule().getLayer();
372         * final var converters = isNull( moduleLayer )
373         *   ? ServiceLoader.load( StringConverter.class )
374         *   : ServiceLoader.load( moduleLayer, StringConverter.class );
375         *
376         * for( final StringConverter<?> c : converters )
377         * {
378         *   StringConverter<?> converter;
379         *   try
380         *   {
381         *     final var providerMethod = c.getClass().getMethod( METHOD_NAME_Provider );
382         *     converter = (StringConverter<?>) providerMethod.invoke( null );
383         *   }
384         *   catch( final NoSuchMethodException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e )
385         *   {
386         *     converter = c;
387         *   }
388         *
389         *   for( final var subjectClass : retrieveSubjectClasses( converter ) )
390         *   {
391         *     buffer.put( TypeName.from( subjectClass ), TypeName.from( converter.getClass() ) );
392         *   }
393         * }
394         *
395         * I raised a question on StackOverflow regarding this issue:
396         *   https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70861635/java-util-serviceloader-does-not-work-inside-of-an-annotationprocessor
397         */
398
399        final var classLoader = CodeGenerationConfiguration.class.getClassLoader();
400        final var resources = classLoader.getResources( format( "META-INF/services/%s", StringConverter.class.getName() ) );
401        for( final var file : list( resources ) )
402        {
403            try( final var reader = new BufferedReader( new InputStreamReader( file.openStream() ) ) )
404            {
405                final var converterClasses = reader.lines()
406                    .map( String::trim )
407                    .filter( l -> !l.startsWith( "#" ) )
408                    .map( l -> loadClass( classLoader, l, StringConverter.class ) )
409                    .filter( Optional::isPresent )
410                    .map( Optional::get )
411                    .toList();
412                CreateLoop: for( final var c : converterClasses )
413                {
414                    try
415                    {
416                        final var constructor = c.getConstructor();
417                        final var instance = constructor.newInstance();
418                        for( final var subjectClass : retrieveSubjectClasses( instance ) )
419                        {
420                            buffer.put( TypeName.from( subjectClass ), ClassName.from( c ) );
421                        }
422                    }
423                    catch( final InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException |InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException e )
424                    {
425                        ifDebug( e );
426
427                        //---* Deliberately ignored! *-------------------------
428                        continue CreateLoop;
429                    }
430                }   //  CreateLoop:
431            }
432        }
433
434        final var retValue = Map.copyOf( buffer );
435
436        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
437        return retValue;
438    }   //  createStringConverterRegistry()
439
440    /**
441     *  Determines the implementation of
442     *  {@link StringConverter}
443     *  that can translate a String into an instance of the given type.
444     *
445     *  @param  method  The annotated method; it is only used to get the
446     *      instance of
447     *      {@link StringConversion &#64;StringConversion}
448     *      from it.
449     *  @param  type    The target type.
450     *  @return An instance of
451     *      {@link Optional}
452     *      that holds the determined class.
453     *  @throws IllegalAnnotationError  The String converter from the
454     *      annotation cannot handle the target type.
455     */
456    public final Optional<ClassName> determineStringConverterClass( final ExecutableElement method, final TypeName type ) throws IllegalAnnotationError
457    {
458        requireNonNullArgument( type, "type" );
459        requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" );
460        ifDebug( a -> "Method: %2$s%nType for StringConverter request: %1$s".formatted( a [0].toString(), ((Element) a[1]).getSimpleName() ), type, method );
461
462        //---* Retrieve the StringConverter from the annotation *--------------
463        final var retValue = extractStringConverterClass( method )
464            .or( () -> Optional.ofNullable( isEnumType( type ) ? ClassName.from( EnumStringConverter.class ) : m_StringConvertersForTypeNames.get( type ) ) );
465        //noinspection unchecked
466        ifDebug( a -> ((Optional<TypeName>) a [0]).map( "Detected StringConverter: %1$s"::formatted ).orElse( "Could not find a StringConverter" ), retValue );
467        retValue.ifPresent( stringConverter ->
468        {
469            if( !validateStringConverterClass( type, stringConverter ) ) throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_StringConverterNotCompatible, type.toString(), stringConverter.toString() ) );
470        } );
471
472        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
473        return retValue;
474    }   //  determineStringConverterClass
475
476    /**
477     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the value for the
478     *  {@link StringConversion &#64;StringConversion}
479     *  annotation from the given method.}</p>
480     *  <p>The type for the annotation value is an instance of
481     *  {@link Class Class&lt;? extends StringConverter&gt;},
482     *  so it cannot be retrieved directly. Therefore this method will return
483     *  the
484     *  {@link TypeName}
485     *  for the
486     *  {@link StringConverter}
487     *  implementation class.</p>
488     *
489     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
490     *  @return An instance of
491     *      {@link Optional}
492     *      holding the type name that represents the annotation value
493     *      &quot;<i>stringConverter</i>&quot;.
494     */
495    public final Optional<ClassName> extractStringConverterClass( final ExecutableElement method )
496    {
497        final var retValue = m_Environment.getAnnotationMirror( requireNonNullArgument( method, "method" ), StringConversion.class )
498            .flatMap( m_Environment::getAnnotationValue )
499            .map( annotationValue -> TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() ) )
500            .map( TypeName::toString )
501            .map( JavaUtils::loadClass )
502            .filter( Optional::isPresent )
503            .map( Optional::get )
504            .map( ClassName::from );
505
506        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
507        return retValue;
508    }   //  extractStringConverterClass()
509
510    /**
511     *  Returns the name of the field that holds the base bundle name for the
512     *  resource bundle, in case i18n support is configured.
513     *
514     *  @return An instance of
515     *      {@link Optional}
516     *      holding the fully qualified field name.
517     */
518    public final Optional<String> getBaseBundleName() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_BaseBundleName ); }
519

521     *  Returns the base class for the new configuration bean.
522     *
523     *  @return An instance of
524     *      {@link Optional}
525     *      that holds the base class.
526     */
527    public final Optional<TypeName> getBaseClass() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_BaseClass ); }
528

534    public final Instant getBuildTime() { return m_BuildTime; }

537     *  Returns the name of the class for the new configuration bean.

541    public final Name getClassName() { return m_ClassName; }

547     *
548     *  @return The composer instance.

550    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
551    public final JavaComposer getComposer() { return m_Composer; }
552
553    /**
554     *  Returns an implementation of some utility methods for operating on

559    public final Elements getElementUtils() { return getEnvironment().getElementUtils(); }

562     *  Returns the processing environment.

566    public final APHelper getEnvironment() { return m_Environment; }

569     *  Returns the comment for the {@code INI} file.

571     *  @return The comment for the configuration file.

573    public final Optional<String> getINIFileComment() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_INIFileComment ); }
574
575    /**
576     *  Returns the flag that indicates whether the configuration file must
577     *  exist before the program starts.
578     *
579     *  @return {@code true} if the file must exist already, {@code false} if
580     *      it will be created on startup.
581     *
582     * @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.INIFileConfig#mustExist()
583     */
584    public final boolean getINIFileMustExist() { return m_INIFileMustExist; }
585
586    /**
587     *  Returns the {@code INI} file path.
588     *
589     *  @return An instance of
590     *      {@link Optional}
591     *      that holds the path.
592     */
593    public final Optional<Path> getINIFilePath() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_INIFilePath ); }
594
595    /**
596     *  Returns the {@code INI} file groups.
597     *
598     *  @return The group names and the related comments.
599     */
600    public final Map<String,String> getINIGroups() { return unmodifiableMap( m_INIGroups ); }
601
602    /**
603     *  <p>{@summary Returns the method that is provided as a source for the
604     *  initialisation of the properties of the configuration bean.}</p>
605     *  <p>It it is {@code default} or {@code static}, the implementation of
606     *  the method has to be part of the configuration bean specification
607     *  interface itself, otherwise it has to be implemented in base class.</p>
608     *  <p>It is an error if there is an {@code initData()} method that is
609     *  neither {@code default} nor {@code static}, and no base class is
610     *  defined with the
611     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ConfigurationBeanSpecification &#64;ConfigurationBeanSpecificatgion}
612     *  annotation.</p>
613     *  <p>The signature for the method has to be</p>
614     *  <pre><code>public Map&lt;String,Object&gt; initData() throws Exception</code></pre>
615     *  <p>and the return value is a map with the initialisation values, where
616     *  the property names are the keys.</p>
617     *
618     *  @return An instance of
619     *      {@link Optional}
620     *      that holds the method.
621     *
622     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ConfigurationBeanSpecification#baseClass()
623     */
624    public final Optional<MethodSpec> getInitDataMethod() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_InitDataMethod ); }
625
626    /**
627     *  Returns the name of the resource that is used to initialise the
628     *  properties of the configuration bean.
629     *
630     *  @return An instance of
631     *      {@link Optional}
632     *      that holds the resource name.
633     */
634    public final Optional<String> getInitDataResource() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_InitDataResource ); }
635
636    /**
637     *  Returns the interfaces that have to be implemented by the new
638     *  configuration bean.
639     *
640     *  @return The interfaces to implement.
641     */
642    public final Collection<TypeName> getInterfacesToImplement() { return List.copyOf( m_InterfacesToImplement ); }
643
644    /**
645     *  Returns the name of the field that holds the message prefix, in case
646     *  i18n support is configured.
647     *
648     *  @return An instance of
649     *      {@link Optional}
650     *      holding the fully qualified field name.
651     */
652    public final Optional<String> getMessagePrefix() { return Optional.ofNullable( m_MessagePrefix ); }
653
654    /**
655     *  Returns the name of the package for the new configuration bean.
656     *
657     *  @return The package name.
658     */
659    public final Name getPackageName() { return m_PackageName; }
660

664     *  for the {@code Preferences} will be omitted.

667     *      {@link Optional}

672    public final Optional<TypeName> getPreferenceChangeListenerClass()
673    {
674        final var retValue = Optional.ofNullable( m_PreferenceChangeListenerClass );
675
676        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
677        return retValue;
678    }   //  getPreferenceChangeListenerClass()

680    /**
681     *  Returns the name for the {@code Preferences} root node.
682     *

684     *
685     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.PreferencesRoot#nodeName()
686     */
687    public final String getPreferencesRoot()
688    {
689        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( m_PreferencesRoot) ? m_PreferencesRoot : m_Specification.canonicalName();
690
691        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
692        return retValue;
693    }   //  getPreferencesRoot()

705
706        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
707        return retValue;
708    }   //  getProperty()

724    public final boolean getSynchronizationRequired() { return m_SynchronizeAccess; }

731     *      exists, {@code false} otherwise.

733    public final boolean hasProperty( final String propertyName ) { return m_Properties.containsKey( propertyName ); }

735    /**
736     *  Checks whether the given interface must be implemented by the new
737     *  configuration bean.
738     *
739     *  @param  interfaceToImplement    The class for the interface that has to
740     *      be implemented.
741     *  @return {@code true} if the given interface must be implemented,
742     *      {@code false} otherwise.
743     */
744    public final boolean implementInterface( final TypeName interfaceToImplement )
745    {
746        final var retValue = m_InterfacesToImplement.contains( requireNonNullArgument( interfaceToImplement, "interfaceToImplement" ) );
747
748        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
749        return retValue;
750    }   //  implementInterface()
751
752    /**
753     *  Checks whether the given interface must be implemented by the new
754     *  configuration bean.
755     *
756     *  @param  interfaceToImplement    The class for the interface that has to
757     *      be implemented.
758     *  @return {@code true} if the given interface must be implemented,
759     *      {@code false} otherwise.
760     */
761    public final boolean implementInterface( final Type interfaceToImplement )
762    {
763        final var element = TypeName.from( interfaceToImplement );
764        final var retValue = implementInterface( element );
765
766        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
767        return retValue;
768    }   //  implementInterface()

770    /**
771     *  Initialises the internal attribute
772     *  {@link #m_StringConvertersForTypeNames}.
773     *
774     *  @return The map of
775     *      {@link StringConverter}
776     *      implementations.
777     */
778    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
779    private final Map<TypeName,ClassName> initStringConvertersForTypeNames()
780    {
781        final Map<TypeName,ClassName> retValue;
782        try
783        {
784            retValue = createStringConverterRegistry();
785        }
786        catch( final IOException e )
787        {
788            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError( e );
789        }
790        ifDebug( retValue.isEmpty(), $ -> "No StringConverters??" );
791
792        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
793        return retValue;
794    }   //  initStringConvertersForTypeNames()
795
796    /**
797     *  Determines whether the given instance of
798     *  {@link TypeName}
799     *  is for an {@code Enum} type.
800     *
801     *  @param  typeName    The {@code TypeName} to check.
802     *  @return {@code true} if the given type is an {@code Enum} type,
803     *      {@code false} otherwise.
804     */
805    public final boolean isEnumType( final TypeName typeName )
806    {
807        var retValue = false;
808        if( requireNonNullArgument( typeName, "typeName" ) instanceof ClassName className )
809        {
810            try
811            {
812                final var candidateClass = Class.forName( className.canonicalName(), false, getClass().getClassLoader() );
813                retValue = candidateClass.isEnum();
814            }
815            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final ClassNotFoundException e )
816            {
817                retValue = false;
818            }
819        }
820
821        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
822        return retValue;
823    }   //  isEnumType()
824
825    /**
826     *  Returns an
827     *  {@link java.util.Iterator}
828     *  over the defined properties.
829     *
830     *  @return The iterator.
831     */
832    public final Iterator<PropertySpec> propertyIterator()
833    {
834        final var iterator = m_Properties.values().iterator();
835        final Iterator<PropertySpec> retValue = new Iterator<>()
836        {
837            /**
838             *  {@inheritDoc}
839             */
840            @Override
841            public final boolean hasNext() { return iterator.hasNext(); }
842
843            /**
844             *  {@inheritDoc}
845             */
846            @Override
847            public final PropertySpec next() { return iterator.next(); }
848        };
849
850        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
851        return retValue;
852    }   //  propertyIterator()
853
854    /**
855     *  <p>{@summary Determines the key class for the given instance of
856     *  {@link StringConverter}.}</p>
857     *
858     *  @note   This method was copied from
859     *      {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.base/org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.StringConverterService}.
860     *
861     *  @param  converter   The converter instance.
862     *  @return The subject class.
863     */
864    @SuppressWarnings( {"NestedTryStatement", "unchecked"} )
865    public static final Collection<Class<?>> retrieveSubjectClasses( final StringConverter<?> converter )
866    {
867        final var converterClass = requireNonNullArgument( converter, "converter" ).getClass();
868        Collection<Class<?>> retValue;
869        try
870        {
871            try
872            {
873                final var getSubjectClassMethod = converterClass.getMethod( METHOD_NAME_GetSubjectClass );
874                //noinspection unchecked
875                retValue = (Collection<Class<?>>) getSubjectClassMethod.invoke( converter );
876            }
877            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NoSuchMethodException e )
878            {
879                final var fromStringMethod = converterClass.getMethod( "fromString", CharSequence.class );
880                retValue = List.of( fromStringMethod.getReturnType() );
881            }
882        }
883        catch( final NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e )
884        {
885            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
886        }
887
888        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
889        return retValue;
890    }   //  retrieveSubjectClass()
891
892    /**
893     *  Sets the i18n parameters.
894     *
895     *  @param  messagePrefix   The message prefix.
896     *  @param  baseBundleName  The name of the base bundle.
897     */
898    public final void setI18NParameters( final String messagePrefix, final String baseBundleName )
899    {
900        m_MessagePrefix = messagePrefix;
901        m_BaseBundleName = baseBundleName;
902    }   //  setI18NParameters()

904    /**
905     *  Sets the configuration for the {@code INI} file.
906     *
907     *  @param  path    The path; can be {@code null}.
908     *  @param  flag    The flag that indicates whether the configuration file
909     *      must exist before the program starts.{@code true} if the file must
910     *      exist, {@code false} if it will be created on startup.
911     *  @param  comment The comment; can be {@code null}.
912     */
913    public final void setINIFileConfig( final Path path, final boolean flag,  final String comment )
914    {
915        m_INIFilePath = path;
916        m_INIFileComment = isNull( m_INIFilePath ) ? null : comment;
917        m_INIFileMustExist = flag;
918    }   //  setINIFileConfig()

922     *  the properties of the configuration bean.

926    public final void setInitDataMethod( final MethodSpec method ) { m_InitDataMethod = method; }

950     *

954    {
955        m_PreferencesRoot = requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
956    }   //  setPreferencesRoot()
957
958    /**
959     *  Validates whether the provided implementation of
960     *  {@link StringConverter}
961     *  can be used to translate a String into an instance of the given target
962     *  type.
963     *
964     *  @param  targetType  The target type.
965     *  @param  stringConverterClass    The
966     *      {@link TypeName }
967     *      for the implementation of
968     *      {@link StringConverter}.
969     *  @return {@code true} if the string converter works for the target type,
970     *      {@code false} otherwise.
971     */
972    public static final boolean validateStringConverterClass( final TypeName targetType, final ClassName stringConverterClass )
973    {
974        /*
975         * There are no specialised StringConverter implementations for the
976         * primitives, we make use of auto-boxing/-unboxing instead and provide
977         * implementations only for the box types.
978         */
979        final var effectiveTargetType = requireNonNullArgument( targetType, "targetType" ).box();
980
981        var retValue = false;
982        try
983        {
984            final var candidateClass = Class.forName( stringConverterClass.canonicalName(), false, CodeGenerationConfiguration.class.getClassLoader() );
985            if( StringConverter.class.isAssignableFrom( candidateClass ) )
986            {
987                /*
988                 * We need the fromString() method from the converter; more
989                 * precisely, we need the type of the return value for that
990                 * method. We do not regard a potentially existing method
991                 * getSubjectClass() on the StringConverter class.
992                 */
993                final var fromStringMethod = candidateClass.getMethod( "fromString", CharSequence.class );
994                final var returnType = TypeName.from( fromStringMethod.getReturnType() );
995                retValue = returnType.equals( effectiveTargetType );
996            }
997        }
998        catch( final NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e )
999        {
1000            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalImplementation, StringConverter.class.getName(), stringConverterClass.canonicalName() ), e );
1001        }
1002        catch( final ClassNotFoundException e )
1003        {
1004            //---* Deliberately ignored! *---------------------------------
1005            ifDebug( e );
1006        }
1007
1008        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1009        return retValue;
1010    }   //  validateStringConverterClass()
1011}
1012//  class CodeGenerationConfiguration
1013
1014/*
1015 *  End of File
1016 */
